item.description:
Hi all. The movie time has been finalized and tickets are available on Fandango for those who *just* can't wait. There's no telling how popular the opening will be, so get your tickets ASAP just to be safe.

We're going to the 7:30 showing, March 11th.

We'll meet up at 6:30, and head in for seats at 7:00.

Depending on which theatre they use, I'll be either at a table at the top of the escalators, or downstairs near the concession stand and the ropes. At each, I'll have a Meetup sign showing.

As this is the opening weekend, it may be busy, so try to get your tickets in advance, and arrive on time to be sure to sit with the main group, and snag good seats. I show up an hour before start time, and we take our seats about a half hour before the posted time. If you miss us before going in, we hang out just outside the theatre for quick chit-chat and potty breaks before heading out for a bite and socializing, so you can still catch us.

 

| Runtime:1 hr. 56 min. PG-13 Sustained and intense sequences of war violence and destruction, and for language

Synopsis: For years, there have been documented cases of UFO sightings around the world - Buenos Aires, Seoul, France, Germany, China. But in 2011, what were once just sightings will become a terrifying reality when Earth is attacked by unknown forces. As people everywhere watch the world's great cities fall, Los Angeles becomes the last stand for mankind in a battle no one expected. It's up to a Marine staff sergeant and his new platoon to draw a line in the sand as they take on an enemy unlike any they've ever encountered before.


Cast: Aaron Eckhart, Michelle Rodriguez, Ramon Rodríguez, Bridget Moynahan, Ne-Yo, Michael Peña
Director: Jonathan Liebesman
Genres: Sci-Fi ActionAlien FilmScience Fiction

item.why: I'm a sucker for alien invasions, and their depictions. Aliens, guns, 'splosions, and best of all...NO 3D!!! Visually, think "Blackhawk Down" meets "War of the Worlds".
